headline.main: Dr. Hunter on Colds, Catarrh and Ozena.

docs.snippet: Our troops are pressing hard upon the rebel army defending Richmond, and here, on the railroad, our pickets are within five and a half miles of the city.

headline.main: FROM GEN. McCLELLAN'S ARMY.; Our Pickets Within Five and a Half Miles of Richmond Deserters Plenty of Food in the Rebel Army.

docs.lead_paragraph: Our troops are pressing hard upon the rebel army defending Richmond, and here, on the railroad, our pickets are within five and a half miles of the city.

docs.snippet: The release of fourteen hundred Union prisoners, many of them after a confinement of over six months in loathsome Southern prisons, constitutes the chief item of interest and rejoicing for the current week. The event will make glad the hearts in many...

headline.main: DEPARTMENT OF NORTH CAROLINA.; UNION PRISONERS FROM THE SOUTH. Their Reception in Washington, N.C.?List of their Names?Narrative of Imprisonment ?Col. Corcoran and His Health? Officers Detained. GOV. STANLY AT NEWBERN.

docs.lead_paragraph: The release of fourteen hundred Union prisoners, many of them after a confinement of over six months in loathsome Southern prisons, constitutes the chief item of interest and rejoicing for the current week. The event will make glad the hearts in many hitherto desolate homes, and extract one of the bitterest fangs which war has planted in the National bosom.

headline.main: THE CITY GOVERNMENT.; [OFFICIAL.] BOARD OF ALDERDMEN. PETITIONS. RESOLUTIONS. COMMUNICATION. REPORTS. PAPERS HERETOFORE LAID OVER.

docs.snippet: Gen. BUTLER publishes in the Sunday papers a lengthy notice, the main object of which is to announce his intention to distribute among the poor and destitute of our city a quantity of beet and sugar captured by the United State forces.

headline.main: THE FOOD PROBLEM.; GEN. BUTLER'S ORDER. THE BENEVOLENCE OF NEW-ORLEANS. THE RESULTS. THE FREE MARKET.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gen. BUTLER publishes in the Sunday papers a lengthy notice, the main object of which is to announce his intention to distribute among the poor and destitute of our city a quantity of beet and sugar captured by the United State forces.

docs.snippet: Pursuant to an order published in yesterday's Times, the Eighth Regiment N.Y.S.M. left for Washington last evening.

headline.main: DEPARTURE OF THE EIGHTH REGIMENT, (WASHINGTON GRAYS.); PRESENTATION OF A STAND OF COLORS. FIELD AND STAFF. LINE OFFICERS.

docs.lead_paragraph: Pursuant to an order published in yesterday's Times, the Eighth Regiment N.Y.S.M. left for Washington last evening.
